data.meanings: to descend, come down, go down, happen, alight at, settle in a place, lodge. anzala - to send down, give. nazulun - that which is prepared for a guest's entertainment, abode, gift. manzil - mansion, station. nazzala - to cause to descend, send down. tanziil - sending down, divine revelation, orderly arrangement and authentic compilation, gradual revelation.
data.sentence: The word أَنْزَلْنَاهُ comes from the root ن ز ل and is associated with the meanings: to descend, come down, go down, happen, alight at, settle in a place, lodge. anzala - to send down, give. nazulun - that which is prepared for a guest's entertainment, abode, gift. manzil - mansion, station. nazzala - to cause to descend, send down. tanziil - sending down, divine revelation, orderly arrangement and authentic compilation, gradual revelation.

data.meanings: Lying down, kneeling or with legs folded making the chest touch the ground, falling upon the chestTo be or to become firm, steady, steadfast, fixed, continue, remain or stay in placePraying for someone or something, or blessings, felicitations, prospering and abounding in good (e.g. on food, or the saying God bless you)Keeping or applying constantly or persevering in something (e.g. affairs, commerce etc)Extolling God and His attributes, exalting God and/or magnifying GodStriving, laboring and/or exerting oneselfAn ancient name of the monthsA blessing, any good bestowed by God, increase, abundance and/or plenty.
data.sentence: The word مُبَارَكٌ comes from the root ب ر ك and is associated with the meanings: Lying down, kneeling or with legs folded making the chest touch the ground, falling upon the chestTo be or to become firm, steady, steadfast, fixed, continue, remain or stay in placePraying for someone or something, or blessings, felicitations, prospering and abounding in good (e.g. on food, or the saying God bless you)Keeping or applying constantly or persevering in something (e.g. affairs, commerce etc)Extolling God and His attributes, exalting God and/or magnifying GodStriving, laboring and/or exerting oneselfAn ancient name of the monthsA blessing, any good bestowed by God, increase, abundance and/or plenty.

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word ذِكْرٌ comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).

data.meanings: to dislike, be unacquainted with, disown, disapprove with tongue or punishment, be hard, difficult, feel a repugnance towards, make charge.
data.sentence: The word مُنْكِرُونَ comes from the root ن ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to dislike, be unacquainted with, disown, disapprove with tongue or punishment, be hard, difficult, feel a repugnance towards, make charge.
The word أَفَأَنْتُمْ comes from the root ا ن ت م and is associated with the meanings: you (plural)
